item.title: 'Tablet Computing' - Writing Computer Compatible Cuneiform Software
item.description: Were an ancient Mesopotamian to find themselves flung into the far future of 2018 through some grotesque mishap, they might very well appreciate the ubiquity of our smartphones and tablets. When they’re not bursting with distraction and spectacle, these small, oblong artefacts displaying all manner of text perhaps evoke the memories of their clay ancestors, both of which became indispensable tools within their societies. Working with ancient cuneiform texts on an electronic device is not quite as straightforward as on clay hardware: with the latter, you can just grab a lump of clay and a reed and start writing.

item.title: Tupshar
item.description: Tupshar ‘The Scribe’ (Akkadian language) Tupshar is a document editing app designed to make it easier to compose and edit texts in the cuneiform script on your Mac. Based off open formats for encoding computer cuneiform, Tupshar lets you produce richly annotated documents, with each word encoding its own cuneiform, transliteration, normalisation and translation representations. Write cuneiform documents easily on the Mac Tupshar automatically converts your transliterations into cuneiform script Export to Microsoft Word or plain text formats Download Download the latest release

item.title: SAAi
item.description: View letters from the State Archives of Assyria offline in a tablet-optimised interface, featuring tabbed panes and glossary lookup. Search for letters by title, catalogue number, chapter or sender metadata. A keyboard toolbar allows for easy entry of characters used in Akkadian transliteration not easily accessible via default input methods. Integrated glossary with lookup of headwords in context View detailed catalogue info.

item.title: Hello world!
item.description: This is a traditional ‘Hello world!’ post to check out whether everything’s working on this site, which is not only my personal page but also a work-in-progress learning project for web dev. This initial release is made with the Hugo static site generator, as a straightforward static site serves my needs (articles and a portfolio) well. I’m developing the theme in concert with the site as part of webdev learning, and as such it’s a pretty simple patchwork at the moment.

item.title: SAAo-SX
item.description: Quickly view and search the letters in the State Archives of Assyria database, even offline Tabbed panes for choosing between cuneified, transliterated, synthesized normalisations or translations of texts. Integrated glossary with lookup of headwords in context Map the locations of places mentioned in a letter Basic support for reading RINAP volumes On macOS 10.
